bill_title: limit the information obtained during an application for a driver license or nondriver identification card that is contained in a database.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the information obtained during an application for a driver license or nondriver identification card that is contained in a database. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any information collected pursuant to § 32-12-3.1 shall be stored and contained in a separate database that shall only be accessed by the Department of Public Safety. Section 2. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: A database maintained pursuant to section 1 of this Act may only contain a license holder's: (1) First and last name; (2) Date of birth; (3) Address; (4) Height; (5) Weight; (6) Eye color; (7) Criminal history; and (8) Traffic history. Section 3. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The information stored in a database pursuant to section 1 of this act shall be used to perform a background check and to determine if the person has another license under another name. The department may share the information stored in the database with a federal agency pursuant to a valid request or a law enforcement agency pursuant to a valid warrant. Section 4. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The Department of Legislative Audit shall annually verify that the information contained in a separate database as required by section 1 of this Act and that any information maintained is compliant with section 2 of this Act.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the information obtained during an application for a driver license or nondriver identification card that is contained in a database. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any information collected pursuant to § 32-12-3.1 shall be stored and contained in a separate database that shall only be accessed by the Department of Public Safety and the Office of the Secretary of State. Section 2. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: A database maintained pursuant to section 1 of this Act may only contain a license holder's: (1) First and last name; (2) Date of birth; (3) Address; (4) Height; (5) Weight; (6) Eye color; (7) Criminal history; and (8) Traffic history. Section 3. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The information stored in a database pursuant to section 1 of this act shall be used to perform a background check and to determine if the person has another license under another name. Section 4. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The Department of Legislative Audit shall annually verify that the information contained in a separate database as required by section 1 of this Act and that any information maintained is compliant with section 2 of this Act. Section 5. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Sections 1 to 4, inclusive, of this Act are repealed when the United States federal government creates a federal identification card that all United States citizens may apply for and any information obtained in the issuance of a federal identification card is maintained solely by the United States government.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Placed on calendar pursuant to JR 6F-6
